Key Arguments: The bill stifles freedom of speech by allowing the government to dictate what is right or wrong.
The bill grants excessive power to bureaucrats, specifically the ACMA.
The penalties imposed by the bill are excessive and threaten free speech.
The bill undermines citizens' ability to think for themselves, suggesting the government will decide what is right or wrong.
The bill is an insult to Australians, infringing on human rights and democratic freedoms.
The bill resembles totalitarian measures more typical of a dictatorship than a democracy.
Notable Quotes: This bill stifles freedom of speech, as the government can dictate what they think is right or wrong.
This bill smacks of totalitarianism i.e. what you would see in a dictatorship, not a democracy.
